overview: Christine Comaford-Lynch contributes to the funds investments in enterprise infrastructure and software. Christine previously was Founder and Managing Director of Artemis Ventures, which merged with Novus Ventures in July 2002. Christine’s expertise is a result of over 20 years in operational high tech positions ranging from software engineer at Microsoft, Lotus, and Adobe, DBA at Apple and strategy advisor at Oracle and Symantec. Christine is a four-time CEO/entrepreneur defining new markets, developing products to serve them, executing sales, marketing and product strategies resulting in merger, acquisition, and IPO. Throughout Christine’s career, she has assisted over 700 of the Fortune 1000 in implementing new technology. She was a founder of First Professional Bank, Kuvera Associates, Corporate Computing, and PlanetU. All of these companies have either been acquired or taken public. Christine has held numerous public, private, and non-profit board seats. She has received numerous entrepreneurial awards and recognition from the press and business schools including Fortune, Forbes, BusinessWeek, Stanford, Harvard and Northwestern.
